result.execSummary:
The defendant Elsa Adele Awsumb was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Order for payment on October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm. 60 days to pay.

NOT COPIED OUT.
filed by Atty Nelson.  Signed by DE and Atty.  To RMW for review. bph
Filed by Atty Nelson. arc

8:32 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Elsa Adele Awsumb appeared by video.  Attorney Aaron A. Nelson appeared by video for Elsa Adele Awsumb. ADA Ellenwood recites agreement and moves to amend Count 1. ADA Ellenwood will file an Amended Information. Atty Nelson agrees and states he reviewed Plea Questionnaire with Defendant. Atty Nelson will file Plea Questionnaire. Defendant pleads guilty to Amended Count 1- Negligent Operation of a Firearm. S/T Defendant. Direct by Court. Defendant waives right to personal appearance for today's hearing. Attys stipulate to factual basis. Court finds Defendant knowingly and intelligently enters plea, finds factual basis, and finds Defendant guilty to Amended Count 1- Negligent Operation of a Firearm. Upon motions of the State without objection, Court dismisses Count 2. Atty argument. DNA sample form to be mailed to Defendant. Defendant confirms address. Adjourned at 8:44 AM. gll

Court orders:

Amended Count 1- 941.20(1)(a)

- Court Costs: $243
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $200
Payable through Clerk of Court. 60 DTP.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Pre-trial/scheduling conference on June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Aaron A. Nelson appears via zoom   DF:  Elsa Adele Awsumb appeared. Case called at 3:30 p.m. Court notes this matter is scheduled for arraignment. Atty Nelson has received a copy of the information and has not been able to confirm with client if she received a copy. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Atty Nelson enters a NG plea to both counts. Has received an offer from the State. Requesting matter be scheduled for a status. Court schedules. Address confirmed. Bond continues. Court adjourned at 3:32 p.m.  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CF212 & 22CF211 (PH)
CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Aaron A. Nelson and  DF:  Elsa Adele Awsumb appeared on 22CF212. DF ATTY: Jeremiah Harrelson and DF: Michael Rauser appeared on 22CF211. Cases called at 3:15 p.m. Court notes these matters are scheduled for preliminary hearing. ADA Ellenwood calls Investigator Geisness to the Stand. S/T Dustin Geisness. Employed with the St Croix County Sheriff's Department. Direct by ADA Ellenwood. Witness identifies both defendant's in the courtroom. Record will reflect identification. Cross by Atty Nelson regarding file 22CF212. Cross by Atty Harrelson regarding file 22CF211. Redirect by ADA Ellenwood. Rebuttal by Atty Nelson. Witness excused. No further witnesses or evidence by any parties. Atty Nelson gives argument. Atty Harrelson gives argument. ADA Ellenwood gives argument. Requesting bind over. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial in both files.  Arraignment scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Filed by Atty Nelson. km
